answers.answer: It sounds like you may have vascular issues.  I would recommend seeing a vascular surgeon for testing to check your blood flow in the legs.  If the flow is diminished, walking or standing may result in pain due to insufficient blood flow to the muscles.The pain and burning in your feet may be due to neuropathy.  Do you have diabetes?I would have the foot checked by a podiatrist and possibly a neurologist to rule out neuropathy or other radiculopathies.

question: 1) I sometimes have pain and burning in my feet. This can happen at any time.2) I can't stand for long periods of time (10 min at the most), before pain begins in my legs.  And when I get off of my feet and lay down, it seems that the pain is more and  intense for a while then eventually (after about 30 min) the pain will go away.
